video.title: The Universe: Collection
video.synopsis: Using CGI graphics, data and interviews with scientists, this series explores questions and topics about our solar system and beyond.

episodes.synopsis: A virtual solar system tour features a ride on a comet and visits to the sun's fiery surface, the mountains of Neptune's moons and Martian caves.
episodes.title: Ride the Comet

episodes.synopsis: Discover why time travel into the future is unavoidable in the Einsteinian world of relativity.
episodes.title: Time Travel

episodes.synopsis: Once they were dreaded and thought to be dragons eating the sun, but modern science has dispelled the mythology of total solar eclipses.
episodes.title: Total Eclipse

episodes.synopsis: Experts cook up 10 ways you could destroy Earth, including swallowing it with a black hole, hurling it into the sun and switching off gravity.
episodes.title: 10 Ways to Destroy the Earth

episodes.synopsis: What are the latest discoveries in the world of asteroids? Learning about these huge space rocks isn't just about science -- it's about survival.
episodes.title: Asteroid Attack

episodes.synopsis: Epic catastrophes throughout the history of the solar system are explored, revealing stunning transformations of the planets, including Earth.
episodes.title: Catastrophes that Changed the Planets

episodes.synopsis: Earthly analogies are used to demonstrate the scale and nature of the cosmos, using monster trucks, the Golden Gate Bridge and a rocket-powered car.
episodes.title: How Big, How Far, How Fast

episodes.synopsis: Contemplate what astronauts would have to do to survive the harsh conditions on Mars if a manned mission to the planet were to crash.
episodes.title: Crash Landing on Mars

episodes.synopsis: This episode takes you back billions of years to experience some of the many catastrophic events Earth endured before becoming a hospitable planet.
episodes.title: Worst Days on Planet Earth

episodes.synopsis: Find out what kinds of advanced technology we would need and daunting challenges we'd face if we were to build a spaceship for interstellar travel.
episodes.title: UFO: The Real Deal

episodes.synopsis: Examine the range of temperatures throughout our universe and solar system, and look at some of the coldest places and objects.
episodes.title: Deep Freeze

episodes.synopsis: Consider a scientific approach in weighing the idea that God created the Earth, and even the universe, versus the theory that it all came from nature.
episodes.title: God and the Universe

episodes.synopsis: With the Voyager spacecraft exploring the outermost layer of the heliosphere, scientists are learning more about Earth's position in the Milky Way.
episodes.title: Our Place in the Milky Way

episodes.synopsis: Explore the diverse canvas of sounds in our universe and analyze the sci-fi notion that no one could hear you scream in space.
episodes.title: Alien Sounds

episodes.synopsis: To gain a better understanding of our vast universe, scientists examine its tiniest components, called particles, noting some perplexing behavior.
episodes.title: Microscopic Universe
